Reviews.Title: “Noisy 5th floor”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night; 5th floor hallway has some sort of AC/chiller noise towards the east end of the hallway - sounds like a jet engine. Fairly quiet with door shut. Room was ok, carpet did not look good, multiple spots, small bathrooms. Staff was exceptional though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MrChai2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on the 8th to the 13th of march location was good the room was clean and the bed was very comfertable. the only thing that i did not like is that they charged $14 for parking per night and $10 for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: M4RK_H
Reviews.Content: Lots of very negative posts on here so I was expecting my 3 night stay to be a disaster, but it wasn't..... Some of the concerns other people have had were there, mainly some of the furniture cloth and carpets had staining (which looked like it had been steamed but not fully removed) and the one lift in service has to be one of the slowest in the civilized world, but they got the second lift back on line the day before we left. Check in/desk staff we're all very helpful & friendly and although no free wifi in the rooms, there were two pc's in the lobby for guest use, so that's what I used. This is a conference hotel so there were normally a number of delegates milling about, but nothing to worry us with noise etc. As advised by helpful travelers on here, I asked for a room at the back of the hotel facing the mountain on check in and we were given a room on the 11th floor. As mentioned, the rooms have seen a lot of service and are past there best in some areas, but our room was perfectly serviceable for our needs with a nice 42" flat screen and clean crisp bed linen. Got free parking on the deal, but noticed that the entry/exit barriers seem to be kept open at nights, so maybe they no longer charge anyone? You need to have a car here as although the hotel is just across the road from a large mall (well a five lane freeway and a couple of dual carriageway's), you can't really walk to any attractions. Guys on the desk offered to run us over to the mall if we didn't want to walk, which was nice, but we took the 15 min walk. The tramline does pick up at the mall though, so you can run round town or down to Tijuana on a $5 daily travel card. Oh yeah, Wendy's, Denny's & another cafe right next to the hotel, so cheap eat options on hand within walking distance, as well as the food court in the mall. Although there are many better locations to stay in San Diego to be in the centre of the action, it offered good value for what it is, an older Sheraton in a non tourist location. If you are on holiday probably be best to go more central, but don't write this one off if you're looking for good value accommodation as a base to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Cuse123
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of Sheraton's to begin with, but I was optimistic when I walked into what looked like a renovated lobby. Unfortunately that was the only renovation that occurred. Elevators were ridiculously slow, room was dark and dingy and dirty. Lucky me, I discovered the next morning that not only did I have poor water pressure, but that the shower did not work. Lovely. I mentioned this at the front desk and they accomodated me for my troubles with a free breakfast (ugh) and comp'd my internet. To me, a working shower is an integral part of the Sheraton offering "hotel rooms" and am extremely disappointed more was not done to allow us to part ways nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: knowhowtotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three days and if you don't have a car it is a bit out of the way. The hotel is not in the "hotel circle" therefore does not have an official free shuttle to attractions. The two concierges, Mel and Robert were very helpful and if it wasn't for them I would have rated his hotel very low. There was NO free wifi in the room, this is 2012' when are hotels going to realize that providing free wifi is not a luxury. Had I know his I would not have stayed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Victor_Manuel
Reviews.Content: Just spend a great weekend in San Diego with my family and stay in this hotel, great location, good service, good rates, the rooms was very clean, great plasma TV my kids love it, we will stay here on our next trip to San Diego, Just Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely bed, but noise from road kept me awake!”
Reviews.Author: Family152
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference at the nearby Town and Country Resort and Convention Centre, which is a 35 minute walk away however I would not recommend the walk - it crosses several major roads and goes under another - very gloomy and unpleasant. The hotel had several good points: the room had an exceptionally comfortable bed with lovely soft pillows and duvet, all the staff were friendly and helpful, and security was very good. However, my room overlooked the road, and there was a high level of traffic noise, day and night. I would recommend asking for a room at the back. The buffet breakfast was good, and the meal I ate in the restaurant was also tasty. Internet was available for a daily charge, but worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, really made our vacation...”
Reviews.Author: nukelz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early Feb, 2012. Traveled with my wife and one child. We put in a request for a hillside room on a high floor, and we were thrilled to see that both requests were granted. I asked for a few more decaf coffee bags in the room and not only was I handed 4 more by Mel, he also went to the resturant and gave me a fresh cup of decaf coffee to boot. The check-in staff was delightful, and very helpful accessing the free WiFi in the lobby. I was a little bummed that the in-room Wifi was $9.99 a day, but that's a Sheraton thing not the property. I used the hot tub several mornings and my daughter swam in the pool on one day. The cooler weather kept us out of the pool mostly. The pool area was nice and relaxing, however over by the wall side of the pool there was a steady stream of sugar ants running along the length of the pool. Not really a huge issue to me as I know they are common in warmer climates, but it did kind of freak out a 5 year old girl. Other than that the parking was easily accessible and plenty of spots available. As for its location, we went to the Zoo, Seaworld, and Leogland and every one of these locations were an easy freeway ride to get to. Overall, I highly reccomend this property. We will be retuning to San Diego soon and I am thrilled to know I now have a new place to call "home" while away from home.

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of San Diego is in Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: JvCubed
Reviews.Content: As someone who loves San Diego, I am always looking for that perfect hotel. Balanced between location and price, the Sheraton Mission Valley is the ideal place. 15 minutes from downtown, 15 minutes from Mission Beach, the location is perfect. I thoroughly enjoyed the service here as well. I have stayed at a different Sheraton in the San Diego area and left felling as my every request was bothersome to the staff. Not here. Every interaction was genuine and made me feel as if I was the only one there (even while eating in their busy restaurant). Loved my stay...I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for local attractions!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location if you have your own transport....less than 10 min drive to sea world and zoo! Shopping Centre + Cinema and restaurants across the road. Room was nice, if a bit dated, comfy bed, big tv! Go for a hill view as it is not on the road side which may be noisy!! No safe in room!! Swimming pool area seemed in need of some tlc! Taxi to gaslamp quarter approx $20 one way....nice for dinner/drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Sheraton in San Diego *”
Reviews.Author: SFDutchman
Reviews.Content: (Note: I am a Starwood Platinum Level Guest) I have stayed at this Sheraton property ever since it became a Sheraton. I usually stay anywhere from 4 to 10 nights per stay and am almost always upgraded to the 12th (Club Floor) or 14th floor (2 room suites). A hillside view room is always quieter (even numbered rooms). The hotel is comfortable and the rooms have the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Beds. Having stayed here on multiple occasions, I have noticed a rather high turnover in staff in the last two years. It seems every time I check-in, there are all new front desk clerks. Everyone is very pleasant, yet overall training could be slightly improved (especially around Sheraton standards). * Addressing recent comments about security: The hotel has NO security cameras and what security at night there exists is very MINIMAL.The 12th & 14th floor USED to be controlled access in the elevator, however two years ago this was stopped and anyone can access these floors - strangely, the doors from the stairwells that access the floors still require a key. I do believe that the hotel does have a security problem (inside and outside), which is why I never leave a laptop, iPad, or similar device in my room when I am not there. Also, make sure the room door clicks shut, some doors don't close on their own. Rooms in general are comfortable, however I believe there needs to be a renovation of soft furnishings, wallpaper, carpeting & drapes. Renovation of the banquet rooms were being done on my most recent visit - nice - but do the guest rooms too ! Club Lounge: As with most domestic Sheratons, this hotel has a lounge the size of two standard guest rooms. The lounge offers a very limited evening service of 1 or 2 appetizers, and a small selection of sodas & water. There is a $3 charge for beer & wine. There is a nice small continental breakfast served from 6:30-9am every day (unfortunately not longer on weekends as with most Sheratons!). The ladies that staff the lounge in the am's & pm's are very sweet and always remember me by name. The lounge itself has never been renovated and is in need of sprucing up. The furniture is too big for a small lounge and provides little area for seated breakfast - especially on weekends. The complimentary parking for Platinum guests is a nice perk not found at other Starwood properties. Of course, Platinum level guests get comp internet access here and at all Starwood Hotels worldwide. I will continue to stay at this property as it is most convenient for me and is a nice Starwood choice if I don't want to be in thedowntown area. One comment for the management is that I don't like being told that things are the way they are because of Remington. The last time I checked, there was a Sheraton name on the hotel and a Sheraton flag outside!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could of stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Vjaynec
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, the staff are even more wonderful too! The hotel is in a great location to the trolley which takes you right into the heart os San diego. The room was a lovely size and was very modern. The foot was great and the staff just go out of their way to help! Such a pleasant stay and would highly reccomend it! Nothing but great words for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great staff, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: kandy187
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They are all friendly and accommodating. The hotel rooms could use an update, but were clean, the bed comfortable and the lobby beautiful. Convenient to a mall across the street and central to where we wanted to go in San Diego. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Terrible Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: MrsBukhari
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel... There are no cameras for your safety. There are no safety deposit boxes in the room to store our valuables. The 2nd lock on the door is missing a screw so people can enter even if you have it secured. There were numerous occasions that housekeeping staff came in before I could answer the door. I am Platinum SPG member and this hotel has definitely shaken my confidence in SPG. Someone with access to my room also entered when I was gone and stole my ipad and laptop! I left the hotel and I am going to Marriott. If they don't resolve this in a positive way then I will never stay at another SPG property and also tell everyone about this bad expereince by frequently blogging, talking and spreading the word about how unsafe you and your property is. Think twice about staying here... There is a Hilton and Marriott within 1 mile of this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daz793
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and modern, including LCD tv, free coffee making facility's and WI FI in the rooms. Location close to the interstate 8 and close to two shopping malls.The Sheraton offered a large free carpark.

Reviews.Title: “No attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Fakapuna
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy check out was easy however you are charged 14 dollars a day for parking and you need your room key to get in and out of the parking lot. When you check out however, they take your room keys. You then have to wait at the gate, continuously press a button, and wait for someone to open the gate for you, ridiculous. When looking to place an order at the restaurant in the hotel, I ask the waiter if they had some kind of nacho plate, he looked at me with an arrogant smile and laugh and said no and walked away. He then argued with me that a dish I seen in my room menu did not exist. Other than that my shower drain clogged, my toilet barely flushed, and the room was just okay

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Platinum Experience”
Reviews.Author: CMXCMX
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week and the stay was great. They gave me a great suite on a high floor, club access, a welcome bag and the platinum amenity. If you value your platinum benefits (and don't like begging for them to actually be granted), then you will be very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Out of Coffee.....”
Reviews.Author: nomoretummy69
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the Sheraton, Mission Valley was great. Except for a couple of issues with housekeeping (room was never fully stocked by housekeeping. One day the kleenex box was empty but the maid never replaced it. Another day the maid failed to replace coffee and cream/sugar packets. I was left with only one towel another day). I called the front desk for some coffee and cream/sugar packets, but after 30 mins no one showed up. So I ended up ordering coffee from room service and it cost me $12.00 for a small pot, which was delivered within 20 mins. My coffee and cream/sugar packets were finally replaced when the maid cleaned the room that afternoon. The hotel was clean and in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “If you have kids get a Suite if you can.”
Reviews.Author: JJ-Hendreson
Reviews.Content: We opted for a suite as we have a 3 yr old and a 9 month old. Having the other room to put the crib in for the infant to go to bed as the rest of us retired to the bedroom was wonderful. Very nice room would for sure stay there again. Good location to get to pretty much everything. We visited friends in pacific beach and went to Legoland.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: captcrash2much
Reviews.Content: We just came back from San Diego and we stayed 4 nights at Sheraton Mission Valley. Elevators: Previous reviewers complained about the slow elevators and I agree. Elevators (2 of them for the entire hotel - about 14 floors) were indeed painfully slow. Doors took along time to open/close. Front Desk: Nicolas was very friendly and staff in general were very nice and friendly. Parking: Lots of spots with a gate which required your room key to activate. A bit of a hassle but no big deal. Gate did not offer any security - only kept out cars that were not guests of the hotel. Room: We had a room with a view of the hill. It was dark and the lighting in the room was insufficient. The front desk did ask if we wanted a view of the highway that was noisy or a quiet room with a view of the hill. I think I would have preferred the highway view since it would have let in more light in the morning and early evening - not a big issue. Clean and spacious for our family of 3. Food: Lots close by. We didn't try the restaurant in the hotel. There was free coffee in the lobby in the morning - bonus !! Loved it. Overall: We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Let's all pray Sheraton replaces the horrific carpets.”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times. The staff is very good and quick to please. I also love the easy freeway access. And the daily room rate seems always near $100, which is well below any other Starwood properties in the downtown area. I also have never failed to receive great Platinum SPG benefits. That said, the carpets in this rather dated hotel, need to be torn up and replaced. They are old and stained. I cannot imagine any carpet company being able to get the stains out. I'm not talking about just the hallways, but also in the rooms. The last three rooms I have had all have terribly stained carpets. The maids can vacuum all they want, but the stains remain. I never go barefoot in my room at this property. On the 12th floor which is the club level the elevator lobby carpets also need to be restretched and laid flat before someone trips and breaks something. Given how responsive management and staff are, my only assumption is that Sheraton corporate is so cheap they are refusing to pay the cost to change out the carpets. Of course at the same time they do that, they should also get rid of the furniture which looks as it is from the 80's. Just two elevators and they are incredibly slow. And yes, the staff hears about it all the time. Remember, they have the joy of riding them almost every day. In the mornings when people are leaving for the day, they can really be tied up. Ze-Net wireless internet never works for me when I am in the hotel. I always have to call the help line and have them get it working. Other people have complained in the club room and at the front desk they can't get it to work, so I know it's not just me. The hotel is old enough that it does not have hard wired internet access in the rooms. For business travelers this is a major inconvenience. The pool is a pool. For families with kids, it works. It is nowhere near what you'll find in resort properties, but it provides a place for the kids to play. For those of you who do not get access to the club room without paying for the upgrade, I would possibly think twice about the value. In the morning they provide a decent enough cold continental breakfast, but in the evenings it is slim pickings. This last night they offered a whopping two food items. Potstickers and deviled eggs. NOTHING ELSE. No cheese tray, crackers, chips, veggie tray, fruit, nuts. NOTHING ELSE. For beverages there are sodas and water in the refridgerator and during evening club hours they usually have a wine available. No hard liquor. If I paid the extra money, I would be let down. Thankfully, it's free for me and I'm always entertained going in if I am around in the evening just to see how little there is. As I said earlier, the rooms all have dated furniture and low ceilings because it's an older hotel. 14th floor has higher ceilings, but that's an all suite floor and you'll either pay extra or have to be Platinum SPG to get up there. I enjoy sleeping on the beds and the bedding at Sheraton. It is always a restful sleep and I know exactly what to expect. No complaints here. The toiletries are fine, as are the towels and robes. Bathrooms are quite small, even in suites. This is an older hotel and until they refurbish properly and remodel a little, you're only going to see single sinks with very small vanity areas. There is a Link internet station in the lobby and one terminal in the club room. These are complimentary for guests. Sometimes when I'm trying to get on ZeNet in the room, I'll just give up and go to one of the free Link terminals rather than call the help desk to get on. For those of you who need peace and quiet to sleep, definitely request a room on the back of the hotel looking at the hillside. The front of the hotel literally faces the freeway and yes it is quite noisy. You gain great freeway access, but for light sleepers, you'll want to request a room in back. The restaurant on site is ok. Nothing great. There are plenty of nice restaurants just across the freeway in Mission Valley, so rather than eat from an uninspired menu and over-pay, drive across the freeway (three or four blocks) and you'll have plenty of options. Hillcrest is also the first exit off the 163 going south, and it too has a lot of diverse restaurants, just 5 minutes away. To sum it up. You stay here for a great rate of around $100, easy freeway access and a nice staff. In the meantime, pray they get some money to refurbish the place, especially so they can replace the carpets.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry G
Reviews.Content: I visit San Diego about 15 times a year. I am a SPG Platinum member, and stay at Starwood Hotels around the world.I always stay at the Sheraton Mission Valley. Emily King and her staff take great care of their guests.Of all the SPG hotels I stay at Emily, Mel Trevor and the staf is the BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: lzlin11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night as an overnight after a long day of Seaworld on a Saturday night. Had no trouble checking in, parking was easy, room was easy to find. Had a great sleep on some very comfortable beds. In the morning looked forward to the in room starbucks coffee brewer. Even had more coffee brought up to the room with no problems and very quick service. Went to enjoy the pool from 10-11:30am. Pool area was very nice, really enjoyed the towels that were already out on each pool chair. Went back up to room, checked out by noon and had no problems at all. Not liking the $14 parking fee. I thought that was excessive. I don't believe any hotels should charge guests 'parking fees' and think it's just downright excessive. Nice hotel, nice, pool, good rest, served its purpose, wished free parking...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii-Fan-from-LA
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the hotel has the standard Sheraton amenities and bed, which I like. The desk was good. However, the carpet was stained badly and my room was right next to the elevator and I could not sleep due to elevator noise. The elevator makes a rumbling sound that comes and goes. The hotel is right next to a huge freeway, the 8, and rooms on that side get freeway noise. I can't take that freeway noise. If you are like me, stay on the other side of the hotel, the side facing the hill. Breakfast was good. The staff generally very nice. Parking and internet here cheaper than the downtown hotels, which can charge $30 a night to park.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great, would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: charlielsie
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for Comic-Con and although we would have liked to have stayed closer to the convention center, the staff at the hotel were great. We especially want to mention Trevor at the front desk and Mel at the bell desk! Both of these young men as well as the other staff were very helpful and we felt like special guests. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were great (although, I always bring my own). We would stay here again, especially if visiting the zoo or outlying attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with ultra friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pleasedtobehere
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4 nights (courtesy of some lovely friends of ours who wanted us at their wedding!) and had a very enjoyable stay. Every single one of the staff members were very nice, very helpful and we enjoyed our stay. We had a room with a king-sized bed and it was SO comfy - two fluffy pillows per person - and our room faced out over the pool area, which was kinda noisy on Saturday night but it didn't go too late. Otherwise the room was quiet and very comfortable. If I had anything at all to complain about, I guess it would be that the bathroom was a little crowded, but that's it. And NO BED BUGS (I saw a review by another traveler that said they encountered them - we didn't see a single one!). We had breakfast in our room one day and the french toast is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BLT310
Reviews.Content: As Sheraton Hotels go, the Mission Valley property works well for a business trip but it's nothing special. The room was fine, but if you arrive thinking San Diego, boats, sea breeze, seagulls, and sunsets, you'll be sadly disappointed. This hotel offers nothing of those pleasantries. In fact, none of those things can be found. The north side looks onto the freeway and the south onto a denuded hillside. The dinner menu at the bar was OK and actually the salmon was pretty good when accompanied by a martini. Overall, avoiding the Sheraton San Diego for another property will work for me next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodations and extras for our family”
Reviews.Author: travelfan57
Reviews.Content: The location was right for us, two exits from Grantville, where Grandma lives. The beds were very comfortable and the bedding luxurious. Free Starbucks coffee served in the lobby every morning. Outdoor pool was small and shallow, but the hot tub was spacious. The hotel was busy with traveling softball and baseball teams and their families. The two elevators for 14 floors took a long time to arrive. The staff was friendly and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Clint1583
Reviews.Content: Just returned from student orientation at SDSU and stayed at the Sheraton on July 25th. Over all we had a good experience, front desk staff was very friendly and after upgrading to the "Club Level" on the 12th floor for only $20. we were more than happy. This included free breakfast in the morning so right off the bat it was a great deal. Room was about average but the beds were comfortable and had no signs of the bed bugs some people had written about. Although our room was on the freeway side of the building, it was a little noisy with the door open but didn't have any problems sleeping. I would look into staying here again on our next visit to SDSU.

Reviews.Title: “Good benefits as a Gold SPG member”
Reviews.Author: dtam
Reviews.Content: The experience as a Gold SPG member was was great. They had a printed list of SPG gold benefit while staying at their hotel including club level room, club lounge access (free breakfast), late check-out, free internet, etc ... and a welcome bag with bottled water and chip. Room was clean and updated. Easy access to everything being so close to the highway and easy self parking, $14.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: elaineboorstein
Reviews.Content: My family and I have terrible pet allergies, and when I saw folks with pets checking in I just assumed, as is often the case, that they had certain rooms set aside for those traveling with their pets. Upon checking in to our room there was a strong pet urine smell, and our allergies kicked in. They were very good about moving us to another room, but they do not keep pet/non-pet rooms separate. We had good luck with the second room. In fact, I really liked the hotel, front desk and pool. I would love to stay here again, but I'm nervous about the pet issue. Unlike other reviewers, we were not charged for parking. Nor were we offered a comp breakfast buffet. The buffet is quite nice, but pricey. I would really like to return (great location, clean, friendly) but I'm still a bit nervous about being able to find a room that is relatively free of pet dander.

Reviews.Title: “The undisclosed Nickel and Dime-”
Reviews.Author: redone2177
Reviews.Content: Ok, this may sound petty but I was frustrated with my experience at this Sheraton. I booked the room online 3-4 hours prior to my arrival via Starwood Preferred. I took this room over a comparably priced Holiday Inn where my friends were staying (thinking it was a better hotel and I could accumulate Starwood credits). Mistake. After booking the room there was the standard disclaimer about how there may be added taxes at the time of check in. What I was not aware of was the $14.00 charge to park my car. Since I arrived after dark I did not see the free on street parking 100 feet east of the front doors. It is only two hours from 8 am to 6 pm. I could have parked free over night and got to my car well before 10 Am. The hotel is located in a light industrial are and parking is really not at a premium. What I asked about the charge I was told they all do it and this Sheraton was cheaper than most. Gosh that made me feel better about it. When I got to the room the internet was $10.00 to use. I know others do the same but again,I do not like being nickel and dimed- especially when it does not cost the hotel anything extra. It makes the hotel seem sleazy and starts me off with a bad taste in my mouth that tends to ruin the stay . The room was large and clean. The bed was ok and the shower head would not stay in one position. Generally I found the staff to be very courteous. Since I am l

Reviews.Title: “Issues, issues and more issues”
Reviews.Author: Washclark
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were told we had access to the club room.In fact, We never really had access as we had to knock on the door to get in. The free breakfast consists of coffee and stale pastries. I though at least I can get a cup of coffee in the morning. When I went to the lobby to get my key programed to allow access I was told by the lady I had yet to see that the other employees were confused and we should not have access to the "incredible breakfast" up stairs. She stated she would let us use it as a courtesy for today only. REALLY? We didn't ask for the benefit. It was given and now we were treated like we were begging. I was insulted. The staff member who works the club room barely looks at you and says maybe 2 to 4 words to you. Staff is is rated as poor to average. The rooms are clean but have the smell of a hotel that is older. Beds are not very comfortable and I have yet to sleep a full night. Room is rated at average. Overall the Sheraton San Diego Hotel, Mission Valley does not do the good name of Sheraton any service. You can closely compare this hotel experience to a holiday inn express except the Holiday Inn will at least treat you to a cup of coffee and treat you as a valued customer and not the scum they would scrape from their shoe. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good value.”
Reviews.Author: cpay
Reviews.Content: The only downside was there is not free WiFi - they charge you $9.95 per day. Parking also costs unless you park on the street. Other than that, its a good value and a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! I've never had so many issues at one hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ravenchow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sheraton Hotels a number of times, as well as this particular hotel a couple of times. So, I looked online at rates on Friday, April 15. I was interested in the breakfast package, but I noticed that my child wouldnâ€™t be included for breakfast. Doubletree had a similar package which cost only $10 more, but it included the children. Also, they have an indoor pool which would be preferable due to the spring season temperatures. I decided to call Sheraton, Mission Valley, since weâ€™ve stayed there before, to see if they could include my child. Not only would they include my child, they would knock $8 off the nightly rate. This was actually making Sheraton about $20 less than Doubletree per night. Since our focus was Sea World and the beach, I decided that Sheraton would work out the best. We had a long 7 hour drive to San Diego due to all the traffic leaving our home city and driving into San Diego. We have an infant so it was a relief to finally pull into the Sheraton property and get out of the car. We checked in at 8 pm. There was no mention of breakfast vouchers and I forgot to ask about them since I was simply relieved that we arrived. This is odd though, since our increased rate actually helps pay for the vouchers so Iâ€™m not sure why the check-in clerk would â€œforgetâ€� what we paid. We went out to dinner after settling into our room and returned to the hotel around 10 pm. I stopped at the front desk and spoke to the same gentleman who assigned our room. He looked up the info and said that our package only included 1 breakfast per day. I was confused since the original booking was for 2 breakfasts and I called to see if we could add our child to the package. Now we are receiving less than what I had originally called about? The person on the phone had switched us to a government discount, but that was what he selected when doing the offer over the phone when I explained that I needed our son added into the breakfast package. We argued quite a bit and the gentleman would not change anything. Now, we actually have less than what I originally called about and we already were in our room at 10 at night, when we couldâ€™ve been staying at Doubletree. Finally, he said I could use the free Internet service included in my room package and look up my email confirmation. If I could show him confirmation of this arrangement, then he would give us the breakfast vouchers. I printed a copy of my email confirmation and showed him the following typed info in my email, which I have copied and pasted below from the email: FULL BREAKFAST FOR 1 Per Person/per Stay He said that the above message did not mean each person received a breakfast. I explained that in English, the word â€œperâ€� means â€œeachâ€� so the above statement actually reads: Full breakfast for 1 each person each stay. It really didnâ€™t matter what I said because he said that we did not get breakfast, other than for 1 person. I was getting angrier and angrier at this point because this was not the arrangement I made when agreeing to book a room on Friday and the printed email confirmation in my hand meant absolutely nothing. We couldâ€™ve been at the Doubletree for $10 more ($18 more after this supposed discount) and been swimming in an indoor pool that evening. I told him that he needed to get a manger that could see to this arrangement that I paid for on Friday. He stated that he was the manager. I started raising my voice pretty loudly and other customers were in the lobby off and on during this long, heated exchange. I assumed because I got so loud, he finally gave me the vouchers for all 3 nights for the 3 people in my family. I was seething by the time I headed upstairs to our room. This would be our last stay at any Sheraton Hotel. Never again. We thought there was a hot breakfast buffet like the Sheraton in Anaheim, but the next morning, we discovered there were only some discount store pastries and cereal boxes available. I had asked during the reservation if this breakfast arrangement was the hot buffet we were accustomed to in Anaheim. We apparently werenâ€™t the only confused customers because as we sat there, a few other families entered, looking for the buffet. The vouchers stated that we could order off the menu, so we did. The service was poor & there were hardly any customers in the restaurant. I wasnâ€™t surprised. This entire breakfast experience actually made us laugh about the fact we were so angry about leaving out our breakfasts entirely when we checked-in to the hotel. McDonaldâ€™s wouldâ€™ve been a better experience. I took a shower after breakfast and our smoke alarm went off and would not shut off. Apparently the steam (no ventilation system in the bathroom) sets off the smoke alarm outside the bathroom door. My husband looked outside in the hallway because we actually thought the hotel was on fire. There were a couple of housekeepers & another employee on a cell phone. My husband thought they were calling someone because apparently, it was only our room with the problem. I stopped my shower and the smoke alarm shut off. No one ever came to our room to question this problem. Very odd. Youâ€™d think an employee might want to investigate. This happened again later and a maintenance worker showed up and removed our smoke alarm. That canâ€™t possibly be legal. I gave him permission to do it though because the smoke alarm was a huge nuisance. Who wants to listen to a piercing smoke alarm every time they take a shower? The first night we noticed a Going Green flyer in our room. If we declined housekeeping services, we would receive a $5 voucher from â€œparticipating vendorsâ€� for each day we declined services. We thought this might be a nice way to get some lunch money for the day we left. We had to hope that a good restaurant would be on the list. On Monday, we didnâ€™t receive a voucher, but we received one on Tuesday. It turns out that the participating vendors were actually the restaurants INSIDE Sheraton. Well, that was silly. A bagel cost $5 so our decision to decline housekeeping services was a very poor one. The flyer didnâ€™t indicate it was restaurants on the property. My husband decided to ask a gentleman at the front desk if the snack room allowed the use of these vouchers. He said that yes, we could use the vouchers there. That was fine then because we could get some snacks on our day of check-out. On Wednesday, we expected to get our Tuesday voucher since we declined services Monday and Tuesday. On Wednesday, the only thing we received was our bill, no second voucher. Great. Now I have to call and complain about yet another issue on our final day. I called and that issue was handled surprisingly well. The woman on the phone said she would send the missing voucher up to our room immediately. She did. Wednesday morning we went to check out. We let our son pick out $10 in snacks from the snack room, which didnâ€™t take long since a 30 cent candy bar was priced at $2 and a $2 bag of chips was actually $4. We went to the counter to hand in our key card and use our vouchers. The woman said that we couldnâ€™t use the vouchers in the snack room. We explained that just yesterday, someone had told us we could use them there. She apologized for the misinformation and wouldnâ€™t allow us to use the vouchers. At this point, I was FINISHED with Sheraton Hotel. We were on our way out of town and Iâ€™d had it with the horrendous service at this hotel. With customers standing nearby, I told her that weâ€™d no longer be staying at any Sheraton and there was no misinformation. It was all blatant lies. We were lied to about our reservation and lied to about the vouchers declining housekeeping services. We needed to redeem these vouchers and leave the property. She told us to take the items and leave. We did. I wrote a complaint to Sheraton. I received an email response from management at this property, offering us 7,000 points. I had no idea what that meant & that's tacky to offer something that most customers would be unfamiliar with. I emailed & learned that 7,000 points were equal to 1 free night. I'm not sure why this wasn't the offer given. Plus, 3 horrendous nights that we paid for cannot be made up with one free night.

Reviews.Title: “Like my home”
Reviews.Author: LAG59
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great ubication. The staff warm and eficient. Definively is my favorite hotel in San Diego. We forgot a earphones in the room when we leave and the housekeeping keep the gadget for us.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMaddy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a family vacation we took to San Diego. We checked in but did not actually go into the room until about 10:30 PM. We went to sleep and in the middle of the night my husband woke up because he felt itchy. He turned on the lights and he had red bumps on his body. He woke me up and we got off the bed and there were specks of blood on the white sheets. He started looking closer and found a tiny insect. he placed a white paper under it and smashed it and it became a red spot (blood). He was so upset we went in the shower and packed and went downstairs at about 1 AM. We took the paper with the red spot of blood and also photos of the blood specks in several spots on the sheets. We requested a refund since i feel like we just handed our money over to get bitten. Front desk said he didn't have authority to give us our money back but the manager would contact us. We ended our trip because of this. We were to paranoid at the moment to try another hotel. The manager contacted us and refused to give us our money back. We have the photos of the blood specks, the paper with the smashed bug, and photos of my husbands bites and i guess that was not sufficient to her. Horrible place< stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Above average in most ways”
Reviews.Author: detjason
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on business. Like most Starwood properties, the hotel was very clean and service was very good. Although I would consider this a business travelers hotel, I can see why families or vacationers would stay here. It is centrally located to all San Diego attractions. However, it is not walking distance to anything. So a car is required for sightseeing. The freeway noise is definitely a problem if you get a freeway side, or what they call view room. I thought I was getting upgraded until I realized that "view" meant freeway. It is in fact the best view as opposed to the other side which is a hill. But I recommend the hill view to avoid freeway sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, large rooms, clean, courteous efficient staff, business calass hotel”
Reviews.Author: WineXprt
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 adults and three children in two rooms. Very clean and effcient U.S. hotel. Courteous and accomodating staff, clean, great bedding and large rooms that would give it 5 stars if it were in London. Not charming but very pleasant and good value for the money. Excellent location 15 minutes from downtown San Diego, less to Balboa Park and SDSU. Across from mall with restaurants catering to family or more elaborate meals and entertainment. Didn't have problems cited by some other reviewers. Maybe they responded to criticism, but an easy selection for a return visit to San Diego if not staying at the harbor or in town. Parking fee about $14 is an annoyance but less than downtown. No free internet in room is also an objection, but not for one night. Available in lobby. Take away a half-star for these factors if staying more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly good”
Reviews.Author: Ividater
Reviews.Content: From the beginning to the end of my stay I was made to feel as if my needs were very important. We were checked in by Nicholas and Rhyes and they were extremely professional and very welcoming. The room was very clean and the bed was really comfortable. Alice at the restaurant was personable and robert at the front desk excellent. Mel the bell captain was helpful as well. Would go back anytime. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff...Noisy Location”
Reviews.Author: pulawai
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent San Diego traveler for business, usually for 2 - 3 nights per stay. While there are "higher end" hotels in the area, I prefer the Mission Valley Sheraton due to its central location and welcoming staff. Rhys at the front desk always has a warm smile and makes every effort to ensure that my stay is comfortable; from trying to arrange for a quieter room to remembering my wake up time. It is excellent customer service like this that wins my loyalty. I also really like their fish tacos, served street style!

Reviews.Title: “Great Sports Trip!”
Reviews.Author: mattyshaf
Reviews.Content: I play on a nationally ranked rugby tea and we travel all over the country. We were in San Diego for the national tournament this last weekend and stayed at the Sheraton. It was one of the most pleasant hotel experiences I have ever had. I also suggest paying extra for the club level rooms as this was a very nice bonus. Management and staff were very helpful and accomadating. Thanks Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Great Room (Huge TV and Nice Pool)”
Reviews.Author: daverugby40
Reviews.Content: Our rugby Team was traveling to San Diego for the USA mens Championships this past weekend. Since I was an SPG account holder I contacted the Hotel and was directed to Johnathan Elko. Not only was it easy to book 11 rooms but John and the staff at this HOTEL are FANTASTIC. I have stayed at SPG Sheratons, Westins, W Hotels for over 15 years and let me tell you the staff at this HOTEL is the best YET. This hotel was close to everything and we even had free parking with our Club rooms. We were 15 to 20 minutes from the Olympic training Center where our games were, and 10 minutes from the Beach. The rooms were spacious and very clean and very nice including the Huge HD Television. I will recommend this hotel to anybody wanting a convenient and inexpensive hotel. The beds were very comfortable. The athletes loved them and slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: beatrix1019
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, staff was great, location was great, lots to see nearby, close to all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stays with friendly efficient service.”
Reviews.Author: rpepin
Reviews.Content: Notable mention of staff being Rhys O'Connell, Front Desk Supervisor for his friendly and efficient service. Sheraton Mission Valley is a smaller hotel with excellent amenities in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Corporate America - unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: dolldetails
Reviews.Content: We rented this room to watch the Royal Wedding of Prince William and Catherine at 3am in the morning and not disturb our household. The large tv was wonderful. Everything else was average/crummy. The bed is not that comfortable. VERY NOISY from the freeway no matter where your room is situated! Bring earplugs. What I was most upset about was the communication with the maid. We called at 5am before checkout requesting a later checkout. They told us we could stay till 12:30. Well WITH THE SIGN FIRMLY PLANTED IN THE KEY SLOT she barges in at 11:00 am and robs us of our precious sleep. It wrecked our morning. I complained to the management and they did nothing but say sorry... You have to pay extra for parking. There are so many better hotels on this street. I wont stay here again. The Crowne Plaza on the grass side, and the Fashion Valley Doubletree

Reviews.Title: “The staff and the service were impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: terilynfer
Reviews.Content: Rhys O'Connell was an exceptional beginning to my stay at the Sheraton - he was gracious, incredibly helpful, and most accomodating throughout my stay. All of the wait staff, bell staff, and club access staff were incredibly kind, professional, and eager to provide the utmost in service! This is certainly a return-trip hotel for both business and pleasure - I was treated like a queen!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just a couple of tweaks needed.”
Reviews.Author: cane611
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extended period and found it enjoyable. The location is great, lots stores and eateries just a short drive away. The only things I think would be nice for the Hotel to fix, room doors and no mini fridge. The room doors are loud and you need close them hard to shut properly. This is a little noisy at six in the morning. The rooms need to have mini fridges put installed. You can get an fridge for $10 extra a night but really it should be included. Since I was there for almost 30 days it would have been great to leave a couple drinks in the fridge to have after a long day. Parking is $14 a day which is a little high but once again the location is great. The have a little store in the lobby with very overpriced items, but in a pinch at least you don't need to leave the hotel. The little gym was adequate with treadmills, stationary bikes, elliptical and various weights. They were upgrading the equipment which will be a plus. The staff were all very helpful and courteous. Great staff makes up for the little issues mentioned above. Over all great staff, great location and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel, needs lots of work”
Reviews.Author: iheartfood2005
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that hands down this hotel has absolutely the best staff. Each and every staff member I came into contact with was absolutely fantastic, however their friendliness and enthusiasm just cant compensate for the state of this hotel. I stayed here multiple times for business trips, and each time I would be greeted by a number of broken items. The elevators are frequently out of order, but even when they were working, they were slow(10+ min wait) and frankly a bit scary! You also have the choice to ride the maintenance elevator with the trash, towels, room service...... The plumbing needs some major repairs as well, the rooms have drippy faucets, clogged drains, and just generally poorly maintained bathrooms. The gym is tiny, with only 1 elliptical and 2 treadmills; when I was staying there the TVs on the machines were broken too. The windows are insanely thin, if you're on the freeway side, you will hear traffic all night long. I stayed here frequently due to the fantastic location and proximity to where I need to be. I loved having all the shops and restaurants right there. The hotel itself leaves a lot to be desired, but works as a crash pad after a long day of work. If your room really really suck, well, you can at least count on the friendly staff to get you a slightly less sucky room and help you move your stuff. Thanks Emily! Really, it's not your fault this place is stuck in the 70s!

Reviews.Title: “nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrish574
Reviews.Content: This is a nice location for visiting Sea World and Old Town San Diego. We were surprised to be upgraded to the club floor which was a wonderful bonus. The lady who worked on the club lounge was wonderful ( i forget her name.) She was so kind and helpful. That made our stay extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: trvlNstyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. I needed a basic place to stay as I was spending no time at the hotel aside from sleeping. This was the most reasonably priced Starwood property I could find for the night in the San Diego area. This hotel is fine but nothing great. The worst reviews are an exaggeration but the best are far too generous. This property is right on the highway and very old with no noise insulation. Get a room on the back of the hotel or you will be disturbed by the road noise. The room was relatively clean but could have been better. The hotel charges for parking which is unreasonable given the suburban location. The gym was small with poor quality equipment, in fact the TV in my treadmill was broken. The club lounge was not operating at 6:30 AM when it was supposed to open and there was nobody to be found even setting it up. Bottom line, I would stay elsewhere if I needed to do anything other than sleep or could find anywhere else that was close in price.

Reviews.Title: “You can stay elsewhere in San Diego for a better value.”
Reviews.Author: ReshaRee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton the weekend of 03/04/-03/06 on a solo trip for myself and I expected a bit more. It was a overall ok hotel but the fact they charge you for everything and I mean everything makes absolutely no sense to me at all. $14.00 a day to park in the parking lot for real?? Not even a garage or Valet but self parking $14.00 is nuts. Then they want $9.95 for internet? Had I had known this I would have never stayed there. I travel a lot and most of the hotels I stay at offer free wi-fi nothing personal but they are better than the sheraton and I do not pay for internet services nor self parking. Then they have the bottled water in your room with a price tag of $4.00 what is the purpose? This might be minor to others but was big for me. The last part is the fact that housekeeping woke me up not once but twice to clean my room after I answered like 3 tiimes they still persisted to come in and ask after I said "No" I could not fall back to sleep so that kind of ruined my first day of rest and my second as they did it both days. The concierge is nice they are very helpful but thats about it. The room is basic just with a large LCD TV nothing major no real amenities I should have stayed at the Hyatt in Mission bay as I was going to next time I will. Would I reccomend this to my friends no...it's not worth what I Payed personally your in. The Sheraton is now in the same class to me as Hampton inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beds & bedding”
Reviews.Author: LoyalFunandSunSeeker
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a Starwood preferred floor. The Hotel is well built. We did not have any noise problem hearing our neighbors. I did not like having everything in plastic such as the drinking glasses in the bathroom and by the ice bucket. It was like motel six and out of place. Also, there was no stationary and envelopes or directory of services booklet. I like these items in the desk drawer. They are always present in a 4 star property. This hotel is rated four stars but I think that was overly generous. The room was a bit small as well, probably 400 sq ft. With that said, we slept well. The curtains did a good job of blocking out light.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service, they go go out of their way to accommodate you”
Reviews.Author: juliterry
Reviews.Content: I had the best experience. We called, looking for vaccancy and Junior helped us get a room. He was amazing! He went beyond great customer service to make sure had what we needed and helped getting the things we did need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiian14
Reviews.Content: Being part of the hospitality industry, I have a keen eye of outstanding customer service and Sheraton Mission Valley has it! They were inviting and welcoming upon arrival. Check in was quick and easy. Later in the evening, we had some issues with smokers near our room, and Junior was quick to resolve the issue in a timely manner and to our satisfaction. We loved our room and the view of Mission Valley. We will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE SERVICE HOUSEKEEING”
Reviews.Author: BOGOSGOLD
Reviews.Content: I travel with my family we arrive the 23 of december 2010, what happened was the 25/dec/2010, the housekeeping she star to bader at 7:20 AM and we answer we are slpee please come later, we leave the hotel at 9:40 am and we come back at 9:00pm whe we come back she do not clean the room, I went to the front desk and the only person how was there he informed to me I tell the housekeeping do not clean the room, after more than one hour of disscutions he offer us to change the room, but nobody was there to help us with the luggage, I request to call with the manager but he tell me this is not possible. They charge in full the price of the hotel. BEAWARE YOU NEED BY YOUR SELF TOCLEAN THE ROOM IFYOU DO NOT WAKEUP BEFORE 7:00 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: orange-u-tall
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton in Mission Valley will not overwhelm you with anything remarkable, but it will not disappoint you in any way either. That is exactly what I expected. A friendly, efficient staff along with a nice clean room is all I wanted and I got it. The value is nice, and the location keeps you close enough to downtown and the Stadium that you never are faced with too long of a commute. My favorite thing about the Sheraton are its green policies and the fitness center. The fitness center was one of the better ones I have encountered in a mid-level hotel in quite some time. It had a nice range of dumbbells, medicine balls, and a few cardio machines as well. I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable but a bit far from the harbour”
Reviews.Author: GulliverBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We drove from Los Angeles airport straight to San Diego. The Sheraton was clean, comfortable and the staff were very helpful. Rooms were clean and tidy with a plasma TV and 2 lounge chairs which we used at the end of each day to discuss our San Diego adventures. Our room was roadside, however there was not much road noise given the amount of traffic. We were aware that the Sheraton (as are a number of other top rated hotels) is about 5 kms from the city so without a car it would have been much harder to get around. It is however very close to shops and restaurants (walking distance). Would definitely recommend staying here however distance to the harbour should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Sheraton . . .”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd or 4th visit to the Sheraton Mission Valley. The reason I stay here is because it is the choice for business meetings/seminars. They have nice seminar rooms. Hotel rooms are OK - its a Sheraton. Nothing extraordinary. If you don't have a car, just realize that there is nothing really nearby. If you want stores and restaurants, you need to walk about 20 minutes (other side of the freeway), where there are plenty of options.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm its a 50/50”
Reviews.Author: OSTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: The lady that works mornings is a totally rude and unhelpfull BUT the staff that works the night shift including the conciege are fantastic,rooms are nice. Downfull they allow pets so we had to put up with a little dog yapping all night long. Downfull ONE washing machine ONE dryer to service everyone. Downfull Spa was broken. Downfill got a milk from the deli was 3 days out of date and sour. Thumbs up to the $17.50 daily breakfast vouchers Thumbs up for comfy beds :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the Mission Valley area. Right across the highway from a large shopping area with almost every store and restaurant you could want. Suggest staying in a room on the opposite side of the freeway for a more quiet stay. Rooms seemed fine and no noise between rooms. The front desk people were first rate and very helpful. The only disappointing this is that they charged $10 a day for internet service unless you wanted to sit in their lobby. I guess I am used to free internet at most hotels I stay at and this was annoying so I didn't use my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: GHDPeter
Reviews.Content: I am visiting San Diego from Australia and decided to stay at the Sheraton Mission Valley as it was the host hotel for the Rodeo. I followed the link on the Rodeo site which went to Starwoodmeetings and booked through there. My confirmation email included a link to upgrade to a club room for only $40 a night, I followed the link and it listed the benefits of the Club upgrade being "Don't miss this exclusive opportunity to upgrade your room to experience our Club Level Rooms for $40 per night. Our Club Level Rooms gives you access to our Club Lounge and fitness center. Our Club rooms also include a free bottle o water and upgraded amenities. For those who like a little extra room for families or for buisness upgrade your room to an amazing Suite for $100 per night. Suites are over 500 square feet and include an outdoor balcony, upgraded amenities and a free bottle of water. Our Suites also gives you access to our Club Lounge and fitness center. Club Lounge includes: complimentary breakfast, afternoon hors dâ€™oeuvres, a variety of beverage options and copier/fax/printer." Well the catch is that the club lounge is only open for breakfast Monday - Friday, and hors d'oeuvres Sunday to Thursday. which is not listed in any of the communications or links I was sent from Starwood and the hotel. It is mentioned on the Features & Activities page of the hotel website. But I was not told of this when I booked or when I checked in. I contacted the front desk and was told the Club lounge was not open on weekends, but that I was still entitled to the other benefits of free internet, car parking and the bottle (single) of water in my room. I contacted SPG chat and after a lengthy online chat with Amy was told pretty much the same thing, sorry but there is nothing we are going to do or offer you, its listed on the website. The hotel is fine room wise, good bed, a little dated decor, room compendium stained and damaged pages, good Air Conditioning, happy looking staff, but I think for the money I could have got a better deal at the other hotels down the road which were including a full breakfast with the room rate. I was not satisfied with the response I received from the initial contact with hotel staff or from SPG online Chat, I believe their upgrade information is misleading and they kept trying to pass the blame. While writing this review I received a call from Lucy at the front desk apologising and sending me up vouchers for Continental Breakfast which is all I really wanted in the first place, but I had to jump through hoops to get to this point and spend an hour and a half of my time dealing with it. There are promotions everywhere saying "Rediscover Sheraton" well Sheraton needs to rediscover its guests and its communications to ensure that all information is clear and concise and clearly stated. In the old days (10 yrs ago) every effort would be made to resolve an issue and associates were empowered to take the initiative and ask the guest what they wanted for the problem to be solved. On my experience this time no one asked me what it would take to make me a happy and satisfied guest, they pointed me to the web page and said its there to read that lounge is closed. They did not put themselves into my shoes to see how I was feeling and I don't think realised that a tiny little thing like a continental breakfast would impact on view and opinion of the Sheraton and Starwood brands. I now have a breakfast voucher, but I had to fight for it and spend time that will never be recovered. I don't know what training programs Sheraton and Starwood use now, but I would recommend that they go back and look at reviewing it and maybe revisit SGSS.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: greg4168
Reviews.Content: The staff was extra friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: kwong12345
Reviews.Content: wish we had gotten one of the rooms and come at a time when some of the other posts came, because this hotel should not carry a Sheraton expectation. It has all of the extra fees, but none of the same class. Parking is expensive, but that is normal in an upper end hotel which this hotel is absolutlely not. the hotel is in dire need of a renovation, smells, provides Maxwell house coffee at time, Starbucks at others, does not have a full order of supplies, bathroom counter smaller than any other hotel i have ever seen and just plain and simply charges at a Sheraton level, but does not provide any Sheraton quality. The service at the front desk and the maids should take a personality course. There are many hotels in this Mission Valley area - would very much recommend checking them out before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Fantastic! Service, Facility & Food Were Great”
Reviews.Content: The staff provided services that was second to none and the amenities throughout the hotel were exceptional (as always for Sheraton's). My family & I really enjoyed the outdoor movie Friday night and the happy hour that was offered (we've stayed at several hotels and just thought that was the greatest idea). The hotel is 3-5 min from Sea World & roughly 20 from Legoland so it worked out perfect for what we wanted to take care of while we were down there. The beaches and Downtown were also real close, but we didn't get down there this time around. We also got a chance tour the facility and to eat in their restaurant and we must sayâ€¦The food was fantastic and their hotel was immaculate! The crab cakes were out of this world and everything "just seemed to sparkle" They definetly take pride in their location and you will "without a doubt" enjoy your stay! Keep up the great work Mission Valley and I will definetly be back next time we're down (even if we're not going to things in the area.....it's worth the drive:) Thanks again and I wish the best for your location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good service.”
Reviews.Author: tkwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is so nice. Travelling on business as much as I do I'm always looking for a hotel with great service, clean room, good amenities and a pool always helps. This hotel fills the bill and on top of that their personnel from the front desk to the restaurant to the room service attendants are warm and friendly. The location is near lots of restaurants and shopping, the Interstate and San Diego Trolley. A special shout out to Junior at the Front Desk who works the late shift. Very friendly and accomodating. Always has a great smile, adds a little conversation to my early morning departures and a nice hot cup of coffee as I head out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Not Much Has Changed”
Reviews.Author: BobTheRetired
Reviews.Content: Recent reviews of this property noted deficiencies in areas such as charging for parking, charging for internet, "nickel and diming" guests, overly chlorinated pool, and so on. Nothing has changed. Parking is still $14 per night, automatically charged. I knew there was a charge for internet, so for the two nights I stayed, I did not bring my laptop. Had I used it, the cost was the amount of my monthly DSL charge at home. Except for calling another room in the hotel, use of the phone in any manner will cost you--even a toll-free call will be charged if it lasts over 30 minutes. So I refused to even lift the receiver up. Our room faced the I-8 freeway and the traffic noise was loud. One reviewer pined that they wished there was bottled water in the room. Amazingly the hotel had placed two bottles of water (Arrowhead, which you can buy at every store in the area) in the room, but if you dared open them, you would be charged another $4 for each one. Another reviewer spoke of a refrigerator, but my room did not have one (I could have used it to store my insulin). More things lacking: no safe in the room; no writing pen or stationary (there was a note pad with about 4 sheets of paper next to the phone); no Bible; no telephone book; no directory of hotel services; no outlets for plugging in electronics and chargers, etc. except for one outlet on the desk lamp (and a duplex outlet in the bathroom, but no shelf space to use) They do provide in-room coffee, BUT they provide only one pack of regular coffee and one pack of decaffinated, each for a single 12 oz. cup. My wife and I were unable to each have a cup of decaf in the evening or a cup of regular in the morning. There was also a single creamer in each stirrer pack which did have 2 sugars and 1 artificial sweetner in each one. The coffee was a product of Starbucks, which I normally do not like, but this coffee was good. The restaurant-bar was so-so. We ate dinner there once and were not impressed by the food. My wife complained that the decaf was horrible. We passed up the breakfast buffet for $15 a head (in my younger years I could have gotten my money's worth, but no longer is that true at that price). They did have ala carte, but I did not see the menu. No menus are posted anywhere. Will I come back to this property? Not hardly.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationperson50226
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, it was a pleasure staying here. Rooms very comfortable, the two rooms we had were very comfortable and spotless. Pool area too was very well maintained we had kids with us so spent some time outside, plenty of pool towels and just a very relaxing large area - not always the case at a hotel pool - staff excellent, very customer service oriented and helpful. A+ would definitely recommend to others and would rebook.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Mission Valley, pet friendly, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is a good if not terribly exciting option in Mission Valley. Rooms are a little on the small side but comfortable. Some have been renovated more recently than others. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Parking was a bit of a trick - there are two key-carded lots, one of which is a bit of a walk and not as easily accessible, but there isn't an extra charge. We did have a FANTASTIC dinner and drinks downstairs in the restaurant - could have been a fluke, but it sure was good.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtravlr2436
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stay at your hotel weekly. There is a lot to be said about a hotel by the overall professionalism at the front desk. When we check out of your hotel each morning, we are greeted by Junior who works the front desk. He never misses an opportunity to give us a friendly "good morning", nor does he miss a beat in offering us a newspaper and freshly made coffee. By the way, Junior makes the best coffee and it's the best I've had in a hotel lobby in a long time. Junior also recommends places to visit in the Mission Valley area and he's just fun to talk to. Kudos to your hotel and to whomever hired Junior. He's good for business and I hope he is with your hotel for many years to come! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: ShiverZ66
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here after a hectic week in LA and found it to be quite a breath of fresh air! The location is great, as it's only 30 minutes taxi ride from the city centre and we were greeted by a bellboy at the front door. We were capable of carrying our own bags, but it was very nice to be offered. When we got to the front desk, the staff were very polite and welcoming, they even informed us of a free valet service that could take us into the city centre or across the way to Mission Valley. Our room was spacious and had an amazing view, the beds were comfortable with a selection of different softness of pillow (We thought this was amazing!) and a big screen TV. The bathroom was roomy and very clean. There was even an ice and vending machine down the hall. The local area is fantastic, as across the free-way you have Mission Valley (Easily walk-able), which is jammed packed with many shopping malls, eateries and even a cinema. There is also a convenience store at the local gas station just down from the hotel, if you want to buy milk or any other items. Within Mission Valley, there is a Trolly station, which you can take into the city centre and Balboa Park. They connect with various buses, so you can get to Mission Bay Beach.

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't lucky in choosing the Sheraton among other hotels in same area”
Reviews.Author: ameera02
Reviews.Content: I'm a tourist from Kuwait I stayed at the Sheraton for 2 weeks (July 1-16/2010) which is a very extended stay at least I should have a decent room. but unfortunately the first room was dirty while I was pushing the chair in the room to have it closer to the window I found a very dirty spot hidden by that armed chair as if they want to hide the dirt rather than to clean it. I was given another room and because we (my daughter and I) were very tired it was a very long trip (18hrs flying). we satyed in that room which we later discovered that it was lousy and in avery bad condition . the paper towel handle was broken every time I pull a tissue the whole thing falls down the shower curtain is damaged and very old. the house keeping servise I strongly believe that they don't change the sheets or the pellow cases. I mean it is was very awful and dreadful experience for tme and my daughter. I don't recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “stylish yet functional”
Reviews.Author: dtrainbrother
Reviews.Content: what can i say about this hotel , well its a little pricey , but it did what it was suppose to do ........ you have to pay for parking , must be a california thing

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff... but lots of hidden charges... cost for internet & parking.”
Reviews.Author: stooges_dave
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with friendly staff but their web site doesn't mention, and I didn't find out until I checked in that parking is an extra $14 per day and they also charge $9.95 per day for internet access. I could have easily parking in the street for free but didn't know that was an option. When I returned from the wedding we attended found out that the bar closed at 11pm and we had to vacate the bar at 11:30pm. Other than these 'got yas' the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING PERSONALIZED SERVICE !!”
Reviews.Author: Barryec
Reviews.Content: On 05 May 2010 we finished an 18 day Colombia/Panama Canal/Costa Rica/Mexico cruise on Holland America's Ryndam, departing the ship in San Diego. We arrived at the Mission Valley Sheraton many hours before regular check-in time. No problem! The young woman at the desk stored our bulky luggage in a safe room and expedited our room availability, while we lounged outside at the pool with a coffee from their restaurant. The room was excellent: spacious, clean, nice furniture and a great view of the gorgeous red bougainvillea bushes sprawling all around the pool, and the pretty hills behind the hotel. We had only two days to see as much of San Diego as possible, so the front desk called Derek of the Bell Staff over to help us.. He arranged transportation to visit Balboa Park for the afternoon. (Lovely!) and, since it was Cinco de Mayo and a huge party was going on that evening in Old Town, Derek got us there (and back when we called later that night)! The following morning the Bell Staff drove us to Old Town again, where we boarded the Old Town Trolley and had a GREAT tour of San Diego, with easy on/easy off at different places for lunch, etc. culminating in a visit to the famous/beautiful Hotel Del Coronado. We had a GREAT TIME. Next time we're in San Diego we weill be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stays”
Reviews.Author: juliemlarkin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and everytime I come back to San Diego this is where I will stay. The service was amazing; Emily the Front Office Manager went above and beyond for my family. The hotel is in a great location close to shopping and dining. It is also very clean, the rooms are spacious and they have a heated pool (hard to find in San Diego). Thank you for your hospitality, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: JTRJR1
Reviews.Content: I love my vacation trips to San Diego and one of the reasons is the quality of the accomodations, amenities and service I always receive on my frequent stays. I have been especially impressed with the staff at the reception desk, the Club Lounge and housekeeping. I have noticed many improvements on my most recent visit and impressed with the new manager!

Reviews.Title: “I got scabies / bed bugs from this hotel and am covered with red welts”
Reviews.Author: jacaal24
Reviews.Content: I have travelled for business since 1986 and have never encountered bed bugs. I stayed there Friday and Saturday night 4/16 and 4/17, and by Monday morning was covered in red itchy bumps on my neck, wrists, hands and waist area. The dermatologist determined it is SCABIES! I now need to have my home de-contaminated, continue on medication and cannot go to work. I have contacted the hotel and they are"checking into it".... They charge $14.00 a night to park your car and don't divulge that up front. There are plenty of great hotels such as The Courtyard /Spectrum Center who go out of their way to make you feel welcome and the parking is actually free....what a concept! I am upset and disappointed in the experience I had with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: texastech
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becuase we were spending a few days at the zoo, Seaworld, and other sights around San Diego. This hotel was quite central to all of these locations, and was a fine place to crash during an active stay in the area. It is on the highway and you are car dependent if you stay here. The pros: very comfortable beds, clean, good sized room, friendly staff, easy freeway access to get anywhere in San Diego, many restaurants and malls within a few minute drive, nice pool. Cons: high parking fee for unsecured surface parking in front of the hotel, nothing in walking distance, not much charm and nothing unique (cookie cutter business hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel, but away from the City”
Reviews.Author: mjcampbell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an overnight business trip. As it is away from most everything, you'll need a car, but they have free parking. Mission Valley Mall across the street, so if that's your thing, then there you go. Front desk staff was very nice, and went the extra mile to meet my silly requests. I arrived late, and the restaurant/bar in the hotel closed early. I really don't think that 9:30 is too late to expect a drink at the bar, but they don't do brisk business. There are the usual suspects nearby for food and drink, but they are mostly chains (Denny's, etc) or dive bars. You'll need to drive some to find anything more adventurous. Bottom line is that it is a nice hotel, good value, very nice and attentive staff, but unless your trip is to a conference in one of the many conference rooms, you won't be spending much time near there. For a vacation desination, it would not be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: EuroDiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my husband. Outstanding hotel, great features and customer service. Plenty of spaces to park, free internet in rooms, business center in lobby offers free internet and printing. This is a slightly older hotel compared to the Hilton up the street, but the staff is much friendlier and helpful. Beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping promptly cleans rooms in the morning. Close to everything in the Mission Valley area. We would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay! Enjoyed every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: cdf123
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. They knew me by name and went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable. The room was very clean and comfortable. I had a great time and would love to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: layayalady
Reviews.Content: Great experience. The lobby was very welcoming, front desk staff was very nice. I wish we had bottled water in the rooms. Would stay here again. Great Place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: msgator
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel! The staff were all so accommodating and friendly. Loved the special touches in the lobby.
