I even used some of those great ideas in our office reception area when we returned home. Met the General Manager at the front desk when we checked in and she made us feel so welcome. What a refreshing experience. The rooms were nice, too......very comfy bed! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: BigDogg32
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel twice in one week. the other two days i spent in Orange county at a similar Sheraton property & both experiences were completely different. my stay at the San Diego Sheraton was incredible from check in to check out. staff was accommodating, friendly & very helpful. I had an incredible view of Mission Valley from the 12th floor. my room was clean & there was a personalized letter that was left for me on my bed, welcoming me back. I was looking for a cigar one night & the staff did an excellent job of helping me find a location in which to purchase one. i also needed a recommendation on dinner & they had suggested Seau's across the street. great beer, great food & sports, what else could i want? i would highly recommend staying at this hotel when visiting San Diego, its right in the middle of the city, so going anywhere is close. airport is 15 min's west, beaches are 15 min's west, downtown San Diego & Old town is 15 min's south, Petco Park is 15 min's south, 2 shopping malls within 5 min's of hotel, etc.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful STAFF that made my stay GREAT for the one night.”
Reviews.Author: Fastfred711
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one night stay driving in from Phoenix before returning the next day as a friend lived near by that I had to see that day. I selected it over the Sheraton Marina at the airport because we have stayed there last year and a couple months before this trip (Thanksgiving) stay downtown at the Symphony Sheraton which was another story not good. This Hotel Sheraton Mission Vally was GREAT!. Our room was one floor from the Top which was a suite without the desk telling us (Surprised us) what they gave us.. When we checked in after a 6 hour drive, we got to the Hotel around noon knowing that it was very early to check in. No problem at all. The lady at the counter (Francisca or something close to that name was so professional and helpful in directions and anything we needed to know. Our room when we got to the floor was on the club level and was at the end of the floor which was a suite. Again what a great surprise that was. Also, when we check in we got a gift bag at the counter with a personal letter hand written with a thank you. We are gold members and still iwas a shock to get that kind of GREAT treatment. Its just wonderful to know that there are times when someone or something makes your stay much more enjoyable every once in a while. The room was quiet (facing the freeway), Large Flat panel TV in one room and another one in the bedroom. Wish we could of stayed for a week, but it was only one night and enjoy it very much. The club lounge was closed for that night, but we got a free breakfast in the restaurant the next morning. The staff was very out going and friendly also. Shopping is close by across the freeway and you can spend all day and evening at those places. Plenty of restaurants of all choices also. Parking is free and well lighted. Thanks again for the staff at this hotel for making our short 1 day stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wildchild37
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Dec. 2009. I am a starwood member and gold as well. It was the worst stay I have ever had at a starwood property.Everything the web site said it had well that was false, I had booked here because it said it had a shuttle to the amtrack and airport and also within a 5 mile radius. Well none of that was avaliable and I was left to feel as I was lying. Why woould I book into a hotel that had absolutely nothing? Also the first day we were there I had asked the maid for some water as that was all we needed and was flat out refused. I had voiced my concerns with the front desk manager and well he agreed with the maid and was very good at saying NO to everything I asked about. I was on the club level floor and well there was nothing special about it and if that was a sweet sleeper bed then they paid way to much. It was the most uncomfortable bed I have every slept in.I have stayed in alot of sheratons but mostly in Canada and they go out of there way to make your stay as wonderfull as possible. When we checked out it was by the front desk manager and never once did he ask how our stay was or if there was something they could do to make it better. I did email my concerns to the geneall manager Susan and well no reply back as of yet. I had a better stay at the Holiday Inn Express by Vancouver airport then I did at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome price, good location”
Reviews.Author: letdasunshine
Reviews.Content: My parents, sister, and I stayed at the Sheraton Mission Valley since we found a great deal on TravelZoo for $79/night even through New Year's Eve. I thought it was a great hotel and the service was great. They have Bliss Spa products in their bathrooms. They sent up extra towel, toothpaste, and even came up to plug in our standing lamp since it was unplugged and there wasn't an outlet nearby. I signed up for a Starwoods membership a long time ago and never really used it so I gave them my number and even though I don't have any status whatsover, they gave us access to the Club, put us on the Preferred Guest floor, and gave us free continental breakfast every morning and access to soft drinks and water(so we didn't have to pay for bottled water they offer in the rooms for extra charge). We had a room on the 10th floor.. and while we were facing the highway, the noise wasn't a problem for us as someone else mentioned in their review. This hotel is conveniently located near the Westfield Mission Valley mall and near a Target, bakery, and restaurants about 5 mins away, and right near all the major highways if you're traveling to Wild Animal, Sea World, or Legoland. There was also places to eat.. but it wasn't not located downtown.. but about a 5-10 min drive to downtown. My other sister came to stay at our hotel last minute and only paid $149/night even through New Year's Eve... so the price is definitely worth it. I would definitely recommend it for families just because if you need to do a diaper run or want to do some shopping nearby.. its close by. Also, if you find a great deal...it doesn't hurt either.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management in every department”
Reviews.Author: thebearscout
Reviews.Content: 500+ guest wedding weekend of our event. Hotel was trashed - staff was unprepared, uncooperative and rude. Everything from elevators and restrooms to pool and business area were littered with trash. There was also no parking available and it is a very dark lot that you have to pay for parking. Hotel rooms also have very low ceilings and rooms are not large... clastrophobic. Room itself was not very clean. Conference room/ large ballroom had NO airconditioning and staff made no efforts to help. There were also bits of food (shrimp tails, etc) on the carpet as though they didn't take time to clean properly between the large wedding and our conference. I've been calling the hotel manager Susan Stevens and the Banquet Manager (one has been fired since) for over 4 months now ... always with promises to return my calls within "24 hours" to offer restitution for a horrendous hotel and conference experience. Many other members of my conference had the same bad experience with the hotel and found the hotel management to be completely unresponsive. Not what you would usually expect from a Sheraton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again - Too noisy if you're facing the highway.”
Reviews.Author: mholi
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel to try something a little further away from the downtown area. Upon arrival to the hotel I was impressed. The front desk staff were helpful at first and offered to send up the refrigerator to my room right away. The lobby is nice and so was the room. I left the room for about three hours and came to find there was water near the tv stand. When I returned, the ceiling was leaking and the refrigerator was not there. I called the front desk and was told they would call maintainence. I was stunned. OK. If water is near and on the TV I can't turn it on so there is no need to stay in the same room. I called the front desk again and got a different person who indicated he would move to another room. You would think that I'd just get a new room and that would be fine. Needless to say I upgraded to what would have been a nice suite if the traffic noise from outside was not so loud. The room is facing the freeway and sounds like a truck is running through both rooms. My other room was better and was not noisy. The location of the hotel is fine since it is right near the freeway. If it had soundproof windows this would be better. I would never stay at this hotel again just for the noise factor. The executive lounge is nice but that's not enough for me to stay again. Try a cheaper hotel if you want to spend your money and still hear highway noise. The parking here was free so that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ggg058
Reviews.Content: My stay there was pretty decent but I was charge an extra $350 for leaving a room "messy". Mind you - for leaving a room "messy". I attempted to contact the hotel to see if we couldn't resolve the issue but they were very unwilling to hear what I had to say. I really am fed up with them. never been to a hotel that charges $350 for living trash in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nearby Shopping and Major Highway!”
Reviews.Author: Gamxiated
Reviews.Content: In June 2009 I went to San Diego for a wedding and booked a room at the Sheraton due to it's nearby access to the highway and shopping. The hotel is very clean and staff friendly, and the location is close to Fashion Valley Mall. Finding this hotel is not that hard since it is an exit off the access highway parallel to I-8. However, we did get lost trying to get to the otherside of the highway for a shopping day at Fashion Valley. Sheraton are well branded hotel and very spacious. Our room overlooked the back so we didn't hear any sounds from the highway. Beds are very comfortable and the flat screen television was larger than most hotels. The only negative thing about this hotel was the parking situation. They do charge for parking in the front, however the gates were always up so you really didn't need access for parking. After the wedding we parked on the side, which needed more light at night. However, the side entrance to the hotel made it safe to walk from your car to the hotel. The location of the hotel is great if you love to shop and go into downtown San Diego with direct access near the major highways. Since Fashion Valley Mall is literally across the highway, there are alot of places to eat at the mall and the surrounding shopping center on Camino Del Rio N. Based on the price, service, location, and comfortable bed, I would recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travelers in San Diego. There are alot of places to eat nearby, especially an In-N-Out Burger right across the highway. Fashion Valley Mall has extensive shops and major department store that makes a shopper experience amazing! Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for Starwood points”
Reviews.Author: travelingUSA2008
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one night stay before heading to the San Diego airport, and selected it over the Sheraton at the airport because it "cost" fewer points. I was upgraded to a suite and it was one of the nicest rooms I've ever had. Super quiet, nice club lounge and the staff was very friendly. As a solo woman traveler I felt very safe here, and it's nice, too, because it's right by the mall, so you can shop til the mall closes then head back to your hotel. Lighting in the bathrroms, however, is not great for putting on makeup; the lighting in the bedroom's "hall" wasn't any better.

Reviews.Title: “Solo female traveler - treated really well”
Reviews.Author: linclady
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Starwood points because it was cheaper than the San Diego airport Sheraton (in terms of points) and I wanted to shop nearby Fashion Valley until it closed. When I got there these huge tour buses were everywhere, people were standing outside smoking and I just thought, oh my, noisy, noisy, noisy! I talked to the MOD who assured me noise wouldn't be a problem and he found me a room that was quiet as a tomb - on the top floor as a junior suite no less! It was nice to be treated so well (and no, I'm not some gorgeous 21 year old, just your average 38 year old housewife) and with so much consideration to my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “No problems, would stay here again. Good service and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: sctrojan1
Reviews.Content: This room was clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable and the room had a big flat screen TV. I have no complaints regarding the room. It would've been nice if there was a little refrigerator. The first room they put us in was a handicap-accessible room (wide-doors and spacious bathroom for wheelchair) We asked to be moved because the sliding door on the bathroom was broken. The room faced a big hill, which is good if you don't want to hear freeway noise. Moving rooms was no problem. The second room faced the freeway and yes you can hear the cars, but it didn't bother me. We couldn't hear the neighbors (maybe the freeway noise drowned them out). I didn't see a bellhop we first arrived, but there is one. Parking is $14/day and there was plenty of parking and it was well lit. There is a Wendy's fast-food right next to the hotel, as well as a Denny's. There are plenty of restaurants on the other side of the freeway. I chose this hotel for the price and proximity to the Town and Country Convention Center which is a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Good room for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenisWindsor
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel I upgraded the room to the club level which entitled us to a tower room (with balcony) and access to the club longe for breakfast in the morning and drinks and light snacks in the afternoon for an additional $45 a night. This was a not worth it. Room given had water damage in the ceiling, Balcony looked out to the highway which gave us the nice sound of cars all night long. Breakfast in the morning was little more then cereal, toast and coffee. Room was not maintained - we got there around 8am there were no clean forks, spoons or bowls. In the afternoon - a sign in the room said guests were allowed beer and wine. None was available at any time. At check in time their machine to make keys was broken. Waited 45minutes to be let in our room (very short staffed at front desk). We were promised our key would be made quickly and delivered to our room. It was not received until in the morning when we called for the 4th time. Computer in club room was not working and no on new how to fix it. When we complained about the room we were offered a reduced rate and then a free night - but as I had pre-paid - none of this was given

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel4workandplay
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a short ride from San Diego hotel (there is a free shuttle). Great room, beautiful location (on the harbour). Very chilled hotel. Free wifi in the lobby. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An oldie but a goodie”
Reviews.Author: newschool_ski_bum
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton, though a little dated, still holds up to the Sheraton name, This one in Mission Valley is right off the freeway. We stayed on the side closest to the freeway, but it wasn't too noisy to sleep. The room was big, nice and the bathroom was updated and large. The front desk staff was very accomodating. Pool and hot tub are also nice. The breakfast we had in their restaurant could have been better. Overall, a decent hotel. Don't expect anything special, but you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service/ Hotel manager not available!”
Reviews.Author: Chevyvacation
Reviews.Content: Book reservation online Travel now .com . Arrive at Sheraton @ 10:30 pm with two young chrildren who wants to visit Sea world tomorrow. Hotel can't find rerservation, called Travel .com . Travel .com confirm reservation numbers. NO Mananger on site. Hotel try to send us down the street to another sub par hotel. Refuse! I asked them look for another Sheraton in the area. They said they found one. Travel fifteen mins. to new hotel to find out there is no rooms. Manager gave us a room from some one elses reservation. My kids finally went to sleep after 1:00AM . They didn't wake up after 10 am. Hotel mess up our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed, I once really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corgimom
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to the Mission Valley Sheraton, It has a great central location and is the closest hotel to our conference center. The first two trips were very nice and I enjoyed the hotel, room, food selection and the staff. This trip was different. The room I was assigned to had a very small bathroom - the vanity was upgraded but the toilet and tub were old. The toilet lever broke twice during my three day stay. Once, I called maintenance, and the second time, I fixed it myself. The roomed seemed clean, the linens were new and the bed was comfortable. I liked the larger TV and the desk area. I did have to pay $9.95 for daily internet. The air conditioning system turned on and off frequently, which would not have been bad, other than the loud band and crackle that accompanied the action, enough so that I needed earplugs to sleep. The nice concierge/doorman was gone and the front desk staff seemed new and overwhelmed, with no clear answers for the simplest of questions. For example, one evening, the hotel elevators were not working for at least 45 minutes. They could not direct us to service elevators, or stairs. They ran low on small bills and would not give change, so I was not able to leave a tip for housekeeping on my last day (even the restaurant could not give change). I called the front desk to request a taxi and a Towncar showed up instead, with a flat fee fully ten dollars over what a taxi cost to arrive from the airport. This is called rogue-cabbing and is against city and convention bureau policies, but I'm sure the front desk is getting kick-backs from this car service. The restaurant was understaffed and they directed me to table with no menu,silverware or beverage for ten minutes. On the plus side, the food was good when it arrived. Leaving the worst impression is my experience after I departed. I found a $4 charge on my CC. I have contacted the hotel over ten times by phone, fax and email for the last two weeks and they have not resolved the matter, nor I have I even received a reply back. On three occasions, I actually have been disconnected by the front desk instead of being transferred to the accounting department or general manager. Twice, I have talked to someone who promised a receipt within the hour, to no avail and I have never actually received a callback, fax or email in response. I left a voicemail detailing my dilemma for Susan Stevens, the general manager, and have not received a response. All this over a $4 charge, but it is blocking my entire expense report, so it is important. In this economy, what hotel can possily survive with this lack of customer service? I'll be taking my group elsewhere for next summer's Mission Valley conference.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Family-Friendly Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the hotel circle area of the San Diego. Generally you can find the rates of the hotels around this areas to be slightly cheaper than downtown areas due to lack of view and adjacent to the freeway. However, to offset this, the rate (as mentioned before) and the proximity to the malls/shopping centers covered up. Location: As Mentioned above, located right next to the freeway, easy access to La Jolla, Convey, and Downtown San Diego attractions within 10 mins of driving. Parking: Gated, no valet available. I believe it was $12/day. Bit on the expensive side. Gym & Pool: No fitness center, there's a nice swimming pool (its heated so its warm to swim even at night and Jacuzzi). I always heard kids having fun at the pool. The pool opens til 11pm at night. Restaurant / Bar: Closed at 11pm. There's a continental breakfast bar for club level guests on weekends else it'll be served at the bar. Lobby: Clean and fresh looking sheraton 2.0 look. Sheraton Link terminals available for use (2 computer terminals) and gift shop located adjacent to the lobby. Check in was very smooth and quick. Was upgraded to 1 Bedroom corner suite on the 12F. Room: Clean and modern. Bathroom is on the smaller side but still adequate. Living room and Bedroom both equipped with a 42-50" LCD TV. Work desk , sofa with pullout bed available for extra guests. My bedroom had a balcony too which I can walk out and see the views of the freeway and the malls across the street. Some people complained about the noise of the freeway. Yes I can hear them but it didn't bothered me much. I had a good night sleep there and I did enjoy the pool a lot. For the value minus the charge for parking, I would like to return to this hotel again in a later time when I am visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot of nice options in Mission Valley- But avoid the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: h0teljunky
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I both grew up in San Diego and know the area well. We know that Mission Valley does not have 4 star hotels, but since we were attending an event nearby for his work, we decided to stay a quick cab drive away at the Sheraton. First of all, the moment I walked in the room it smelled of smoke even though it was a "non-smoking." The bath tub lining was falling off and the toilet barely flushed. After calling engineering to tell them there was a problem, he told us thats just how they work. The room was dark and looked over the motel syle pool. The TV remote did not work. The comforter was stained. It was just one thing after another... We got ready and called the front desk for a cab to get to the event. Knowing that it was only a 3 minute cab ride across the freeway, we called down about 10 minutes before we needed to leave. Our frustration only grew when we were told it would be 20 minutes for a cab. After waiting 25 minutes, now missing the opening speeches of the event, a town car arrives and asks us if we called for a cab. We had waiting all that time because the girl at the front desk called a town car? He claimed to be a taxi but it was certainly a towncar service and I am positive the agent make some sort of commission. $15 dollars later for a 1.5 mile ride across the freeway I had had it. I paid a very cheap rate but even if the room were less than $100, I would not stay there. It is dirty, secluded, and has poor service. It was supposed to be a night of celebration that turned in to a stay of anger and frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Let me save you the trouble-STAY ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: I booked a King Club room and was on the mountain side. The only free parking was at the back of the property. Late at night it was kind of scary. My key card keep locking me out and the hallways were very dark, still and warm. Yuck. When I first walked in the room it smelled of Chinese food for good reason. There was a big soy sauce stain on the bed and on the yucky plastic bench. Did they move my room, no, but the maid did come up and within 45 minutes, two visits from her, and me cleaning the bench I was ready to turn in for the night. The bathroom was yucky, small and old. I slipped in the shower and hurt myself. I reported it to the front and asked it be fixed or a mat be placed in the room, but nothing happened. The room was very dated. There were lots of marks on the walls, stains, etc. The desk chair was broken. Later the manager told me the room has been refurbished, but I didn't see it that way. The club breakfast room was on the highway side and was very loud. The attendant was so sweet, but as I said, the room was loud and small and we weren't impressed by the offerings. We took our breakfast at Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf daily. On the other side of the highway there are many places to shop and eat. Jessica at the front desk is very kind. Nice and professional. If you make the mistake and stay at this place, I hope for your sake you deal with her, because if you have any dealings with Mary you will be sorry. We checked out two nights early because she was so incredibly rude to us. I've spoken with starwood and hotel staff and I hope they will come to a resolution about some credit for this abomination of an experience. The Mission Valley location is fine, but stay elsewhere. There are many many properties in the area and I so hope they are better appointed and have better service. I am ashamed for starwood that this place is part of their chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - safe location”
Reviews.Author: chroy
Reviews.Content: This was in a good location, right off the interstate. The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable. They allowed us to check in early 2 hours! I wasn't happy about the $14 parking fee and the $10/ day internet charge. Overall, I get annoyed with the "nickel and dime" charges of staying at a hotel. *standing on soap box* If i'm paying out a hundo to stay for a night, let everything be included!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: YMacFarlane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location and is quite nice. It is right off of the 8 in San Diego (Hotel Circle) and very convenient to the 5. It takes just minutes to get anywhere! The hotel has a nice lobby, concierge, computer for guest use. We have stayed here often when visiting our son, and the staff is always wonderful and helpful! They have a pool and a hot tub. Always clean. The hotel has a restaurant and bar. I have not eaten is the restaurant, but have had a drink at the bar. The rooms are very clean, large tv. If you leave your balcony door open on the Interstate 8 side, there will be some traffic noise. I keep the door closed, so no problem with noise at all. Target is right across the interstate from the hotel (can't walk easily, but drive within minutes). Coffee Bean and Starbucks right by Target. Tons of restaurants in that area, as well as Fashion Mall. Best Buy, Nordstrom Rack, numerous grocery stores, movie theaters very close to hotel. Trolley is located behind all of the above stores, and can take you downtown or to Old Town. Zoo/Balboa Park very close - you just cannot beat this location! When we stayed at the hotel, parking was free. This is not typical in San Diego. Most hotels charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than normal Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: This was a decent Sheraton. Not the absolute best I've stayed at but one of the nicer ones. The only thing I didn't like is that we were in a handicap room. Why not love it? The bathroom was huge but didn't have any counter space. I ended up moving the tray that the shampoo was on, the tissue box, etc off of the area by the sink just so I had space to use my bathroom stuff. The bathroom itself was huge, but I'm guessing that the reason it was so empty was because it had to be accessible. The door that opened out into the hallway was strange too. Only room in the hallway that had that type of door. Parking was convenient enough. There were these weird gates though that made me think that after the construction that appears to be going on you might need to pay to park?? I did like the location. Elevators were quick & available. Staff was nice. No real objections. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate lodging, convenient location, huge TV!”
Reviews.Author: glacial_erratic
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton San Diego at Mission Valley is a pretty standard Sheraton. The rooms are decent size for two people, beds were comfortable (not as good as the Heavenly Beds at higher level Sheratons, but comfortable enough) and everything was nice and clean. The room also had a decent sized dresser and closet. (Better than the armoirs in a lot of newer hotels.) The biggest feature is the new huge flat panel TV! It was about the biggest TV I have ever seen in a hotel room! The location is in a hotel area, across the highway from a large mall with lots of stores and restaurants. It is easy to get on and off the highway, and it took us only 10-20 minutes to get to Balboa Park, Old Town, Marina area, or Downtown Gaslamp District. For a quick bite, a Denny's and a Wendy's are just a few buildings down, so you could easily walk there. We had a room facing the hill (away from the highway), so it was very quiet. They have a pool and hot tub that looked nice, but we did not use them. There are tables outside the bar/restaurant near the pool. The hotel area is not scenic, but it is convenient and it served us well as a lower priced lodging option that was comfortable for a mom and daughter (21) traveling just for fun. It was a good starting point for getting around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good blast off point”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you just want a nice clean room to stay in. It has a restaurant, but it is very simple. It also has an executive lounge for business travelers and Preferred Guests that serves a free light breakfast in the morning. This is a nice basic hotel. The staff seemed willing to take care of any need and was very responsive. There internet, that we paid for, kept kicking us off. When we notified the hotel they sent someone right away to fix it, and did not charge us. It is located just off of the freeway, and is very easy to get to. There is also a huge shopping mall very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice home base for San Diego trip”
Reviews.Author: micdenton
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights to attend the San Diego Street Scene concerts. Hotel is easily accessed from the freeway and is a quick trip to downtown, Gaslamp, Old Town & Balboa Park. Our room was on the second floor, which lacks an ice machine. Room was nice, updated decor. Bed was comfy for sleeping and lounging in during the day. Front desk could have been friendlier, but did their job fine. Parking lot is large, but spots are tiny. Hotel is nice, typical higher end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: CatMagnet2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend getaway. The hotel is easily seen from the freeway, but it was difficult to find the driveway since there's only a small sign and some hedges and cars on the side of the road. Parking is just an open self-park lot with no covered spaces. Some of the spaces were very narrow. Check-in was efficient and the staff were very nice. The decor is dark wood/formal classic style. There's a small gift/convenient shop, but no clerk - you pickup what you want and pay at the reception/check-in desk. There's a restaurant on site (didn't try it) and a reasonable pool. There's also a "club level" for the nightclub crowd. On the weekend it was pretty busy between club rats and what appeared to be a wedding party/family reunion. The hotel is just off the freeway, so if you are sensitive to noise you'll want to ask for the quiet side of the hotel. The room was standard with a desk/chair, chair/footstool for lounging, bed, armoire/TV stand, bed table and pseudo-dressing table. As is typical, the room was not very well-lit if you want to do a lot of reading or handwork. The room had a coffeepot (on the desk), TV, iron/board and computer hookups. Bathroom was standard, except for the higher than normal shower head which my spouse appreciated. The room was fairly quiet and confortable. The hotel is across the freeway from a shopping mall and group of shopping centers. While this is convenient if you need something, the traffic on that side of the freeway was awful! There's standard fast food and coffee shops on the hotel side of the freeway. If you want chain restaurants or other local fare you have to brave the shopping center traffic. Because of the layout of the off/on ramps and turn lanes, it was very difficult to determine what lane you were supposed to be in until you were right at the intersection. Unfortunately, due to the layout of the streets its not easy to walk from the hotel to the shopping centers. That was my biggest complaint: the surrounding traffic during the weekend. The hotel was average to good. The staff were friendly and efficient. I would stay there again without hesitation, but there was nothing that made me really excited to go back. We have friends in the area, so it mainly serves as a place for us to sleep. For that purpose, it was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL, ONLY THE RESTAURANT WAS DISAPPOINTING.”
Reviews.Author: cindyrae115
Reviews.Content: Our vacation at the Sheraton San Diego Mission Valley was really great. Our room, although I had originally requested a king bed and they only had 2 doubles when we got there, was very nice and comfortable. The staff was especially helpful and met our every need. The pool area was very nice too. If anything was lacking at all, it was the restaurant. We ate lunch there one day and the food was not good. It was pricey, but I don't mind pricey if the food is good. We didn't eat there again during the whole week. It would have been nice to have a good restaurant right there in the hotel instead of always having to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobshady86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Mission Valley Hotel in San Diego for a recreational getaway. I checked in a few hours early with no problem. The front desk was very courteous and even gave me an upgrade to a suite (elite level with Starwood program) which was just a room on the top floor with high ceilings and a balcony as well as access to the club lounge. The only thing that wasn't perfect with the hotel was that there was a suitcase in my room when I got to the room. Called the front desk and they apologized and picked it up. I looked around and everything else was perfect. It's amazing that the maid just missed it though. Other than that, the entire room, bathroom and everything was clean. Breakfast in the club lounge was just ok. I've had a lot better at other Sheraton lounges. It was just very basic continental food. I didn't use the pool or the gym but I went outside to look at the pool and it looked clean. I checked out at 1:30. Check out was fast and the front desk was very nice again. I recommend this hotel and I will definitely stay here next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jsdodger
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful staff, comfy room

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false charges”
Reviews.Author: Severus689
Reviews.Content: We reserved a club level room at a rate that included a 3rd night free. We called back to add a second room at the same rate. When we checked out we found that the hotel had overcharged us for the original room and did not provide the 3rd night free as advertised. (Oddly enough the second room was charged at the correct rate which we were supposed to be given on the 1st room). The manager reluctantly said he would PARTIALLY adjust the rate on the over-charged room until we could provide documentation showing he overcharged us (he refused to accept our email confirmation for as proof), however he NEVER made even the partial adjustment to our credit card. Almost 3 months later we are still disputing the charges. The desk manager was condescending and lied about making the adjustment. We will absolutely not be staying at this hotel again. We expect much better service and honesty from a Sheraton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, But Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mission Valley Sheraton for two nights after booking it for $105/night on Priceline. Although the staff was uniformly helpful and friendly, and none of what happened was their fault, we had a very troubled stay and probably would not stay there again. First of all, I don't care for the Mission Valley location. It is conveniently located to a lot of attractions, but I find it very sterile and prefer to stay in the Del Mar area, or even downtown. The worst thing that happened was when we exited a side door to go get dinner one night, a huge snake was coiled right next to the door. It seemed to be almost 5 feet long. This of course was not the hotel's fault, but I have no idea whether this is a common occurrence or not (probably not). There are hills around the property and I guess there are snakes in the hills. Anyway, suffice it to say I almost had a heart attack! Also, we had to call housekeeping three times - once the toilet wasn't working, once there was no hairdryer in the room, and once to have the batteries in the remote control replaced. That's a lot of calls to housekeeping for a two-night stay. I don't want to put anyone off from this hotel, because the odds are you would have a nice stay. The hotel itself and the room was nice and everything that happened to us probably would not happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel for Lovely San Diego”
Reviews.Author: greedybob
Reviews.Content: I dont know where to start. This place is superb. It is a true santuary and one of the best places I know in sunny San Diego My family and I were all looked after tremendously well by everyone within the hotel and I cant thank the hotel enough. I really did feel pampered and made to feel important. From our very first meeting with the manager, I knew this was the right place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: jb_cmom
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Diego. We read the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided on the Sheraton Mission Valley. We weren't disappointed. It is directly on the freeway, but if you ask for a mountainview room it is a lot quieter. The kids loved the pool. Across the street is a Target and lots of places to eat. We were only 10 minutes from the zoo and not far from the beaches. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay near college campuses”
Reviews.Author: collegemom998
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three-night stay and had an overall good experience. Front desk staff are friendly and efficient, room was clean and very quiet considering there were several different youth sports teams staying and its close proximity to the I-8. Check in and check out was very fast. Beds are very comfortable. Elevators were pretty slow most times of the day, but our 3rd floor room made it easy to use the stairs. Gym was clean and well-appointed with televisions on equipment and mounted on walls. Small with no bathroom facilities. Had breakfast in the restaurant and was very good, but very pricey. Only complaint is that it is lacking in services and amenities such as coffee bar/snack bar. There is nowhere within walking distance to grab a bite or a cup of morning coffee. The in-room coffee maker just doesn't do the job. There are plenty of chain restaurants and coffee bars on the other side of the freeway, but too far to walk. Complimentary morning coffee for guests would be a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JodyM_2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Orbitz.com and received a great price. The hotel is located in Mission Valley, which is about ten minutes from downtown, Sea World, La Jolla, and even closer to SDSU and Qualcomm stadium. If you're looking for a location that's less expensive then downtown but still close to major attractions, this is it. The service at this hotel is what makes it a 4* compared to a 3*. We had a delayed flight as well as a long car rental experience and therefore checked in after midnight. The night desk clerk was wonderful and accomodating. The room itself faced the freeway (hotel is RIGHT off the I-8 freeway) but the noise wasn't a problem for us at all. With the fan on in the room, you couldn't hear the quiet buzz of traffic at all. The room was clean and modern. Bathroom was very small, but had new tiles and was spotless. No fridge in the room but that wasn't a problem for us. There is a restaurant / bar at this hotel that was surprisingly good. The waitress was super friendly. We had the fritatta and huevos rancheros, and both were really, really good. Later in our stay we stopped by this same lounge for a drink and had a very entertaining bartender. FYI - Parking is an extra charge, not included in the Orbitz rate. We were charged just over $11 per day. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandabear88
Reviews.Content: I came here last spring with my boyfriend. We decided to stay here because we didn't want to spend $$$$ staying in the Gaslamp Quarter. The price is great but the location is ok. It's about 10 minute drive from main attractions. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bridgiewig
Reviews.Content: The loby, rooms, and restaurant are all newly remodeled in this hotel. They picked me up from the airport and showed me up to my room. The front side of the hotel is a little noisy, but the backside is nice and has a nice hillside view. Everyone was very friendly and the room felt really clean. The beds are so cozy too!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel thru Expedia /Travelocity etc., AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: puck619
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Sheraton for the Rock N Roll marathon. that was June 1, 2008 (I booked the room March 31, 2008). When my wife went to check in thay told her the hotel was overbooked and would NOT be honoring our reservation. We even had the confirmation code. The front desk was very nonchalant. The worst part about the situation was I called on Friday the day before to confirm my wifes name on the room and they confirmed the reservation. She also called on Saturday to confirm she would be there at 8PM and they confirmed the reservation again. AWFUL customer service. As we tried to work this out with the manager (who was useless) several other Expedia guests were told they were overbooked and turned back. However the hotel continued to book in guests they booked themselves. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone based on this, plus there are plenty of other customer friendly hotels in the are.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: LetsGetaway98
Reviews.Content: We were just returning from a cruise and wanted a hotel close to the zoo, so we chose the Sheraton. We really enjoyed our stay and thought the lobby & our room were very nice. The front desk staff were very friendly, and the bell hop was great and extremely helpful in getting us places. The shuttle service was a nice service quite a few times. The only downside was if you don't have a car you have to cross quite a few lanes of traffic on the highways there just to get over to the restaurants & shopping, other than that we loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Completly Exceeded All of My Expectations- Delightful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missgemni
Reviews.Content: Coming to the Sheraton mission Valley was a refreshing and delightful experience, a complete contrast after a horrible experience with the car rental at Hertz at the san Diego airport. We were checked in quickly even though we arrived a few hours earlier than expected, and were immediately upgraded to a deluxe suite. We were politely informed about the free happy hour, free breakfast-- which was fabulous! The hotel is very conveniently located *assuming you have a rental car) next to fashion valley and other shopping, as well as freeways and the airport. The room itself was fabulous-- HUGE, since we got upgraded to a suite. It was a very very pleasant surprise, and we were very pleased with our experience at this hotel. I got a chance to go swimming in the morning as well and the pool is very clean and has plenty of towels for guests to use. This hotel has exceeded all of my expectations. I travel fairly often but I have to say that this is one of my favorite hotel experiences :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: doctorecr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four days while at a workshop. My room was very clean, quiet and quite comfortable with literally nothing to complain about. The public areas were also quite nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only problem was with the elevators. They simply weren't were up to handling a crowd. The restaurant was okay. There's not much else really close but a fifteen minute walk will give you a nice selection of places to eat. I do recommend getting a room away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: blueeyz028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a few friends on vacation last summer. What a wonderfully pleasant experience! The customer service was just incredible. They gave us maps and directions to everywhere we were interested in going. They also gave us hints as to places we might enjoy. The only down side to this hotel is that it isn't anywhere near a beach. My friends and I had hoped to stay right on the beach. However, for this price, it was worth the short drive every day. There is a ton of shopping across the road. The best part of this hotel was truly the people employed there. If I were to stay in that area again, it would be at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler15
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what we were hoping for. A comfortable, clean hotel with very attentive and friendly staff. A great breakfast each morning perfect location. We've stayed at a few different hotels in the Mission Valley Circle over the years and this was certainly the best. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tennismom1
Reviews.Content: The outside of the Sheraton is dated, but the inside lobby is very nice. The elevator even has wood paneled walls. The person (guy) at the front desk was pleasant, but did not give me any information about the hotel, such as where to park the car, or what they offered in terms of restaurants, etc. I checked in the room for the book on "Guest Services", but only found a menu for room service. I finally had to call down to the desk to ask about a restaurant on site that might provide coffee and a roll. The thermastat in my room did not work. It only blew cold air. They said they would send the maintenance man, but when I returned all I found was a small floor heater. I was there 3 nights, and to my knowledge the thermastat was never fixed. At least they could have left me a message explaining why they left me a portable heater. The worst part about the hotel is how noisy it is. The freeway is right outside your window. When I was checking out, they ask me how my stay was. I said, "Noisy". They said, "Well, next time you will have to stay on the hill side." Trust me, there will not be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but nickeled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: jj95tt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and fairly convenient since it's right off a major highway. If you stay in a room facing the highway, it is noisy, but did not bother us too much since we're not light sleepers. We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2007. The worst part of the hotel was the internet usage fees - there is wired internet available in the room, but it cost $10, and apparently that's only for a few hours (we wanted to get it around 7am in the morning, but balked when we saw that it expired at noon). There is also an initial fee plus time-related charge to use the computers downstairs in the business center. I usually stay at places that offer completely free internet, so this seemed ridiculously expensive to me, considering we were paying $165 a night for the room. The other thing that bugged me was that they did not replace soap and shampoo in the room for the first two days. I had to call and ask them for it since we were running out. There is also a $10 or $12 per day charge to park in the parking lot. The turndown service was inconsistent - 2 nights we got it, and 2 nights we didn't. Overall it was a decent stay, but we felt nickeled and dimed.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deardiva
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last two years. This is consistently a great place to stay when in SD. Location is great, it is close to everything, including downtown, and the beaches. The entire staff is always welcoming and friendly. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. If you want a quiet room, I recommend requesting a room away from the elevators and facing the hill (not the freeway) if possible. On a side note, if you are a foodie - be sure to visit Extraordinary Desserts in Hillcrest. Having grown up in SD, I never miss an opportunity to stop by by this most wonderful place for dessert when I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: HotTubJohnny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Mission Valley for 2 nights. Overall we were quite pleased. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room is nothing spectacular, but its a solid 3 star room with nice pillows and linens. The location was very convenient. Mission Valley is right off I-8 and was convenient to the zoo, downtown, old town, la jolla, just about everywhere we went took 10 minutes or less. The pool was nicer than expected. It doesn't look great in the pictures on the hotel's website, but it was nicely landscaped, had music playing, drink and food service from the restaurant, towels, and was heated. It was a nice break after a long day at the zoo. We were on the club level. All rooms on the club level have balconies, other floors do not. Definitely get a room on the back side of the hotel. The freeway side is right on top of the freeway and would be quite noisy. Only thing i'd say was sub-par is the bathrooms. They're small, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaCJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights here and found it to be clean, quiet and mostly comfortable. The hotel is right on a major freeway so request a room facing the mountain, they are very quiet. Check in right at the check in time to improve your chances of getting one. We showed up at 3:00 on the dot, and although a room away from the freeway was not available then, one was being cleaned if we were willing to wait. We checked in, held the room, went out on the town, and came back later for our keys. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomadating. The hotel appears to be undergoing rennovations to update it's appearance and hopefully it's rooms. They were average for a much lower quality hotel. This hotel does not have the super sleeper mattresses that Sheraton has been advertising as being in every one of their rooms, the pillows were also pretty flat.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: msquare
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline back in the summer of 2005. We were assigned the worst room in the whole complex. The room itself was fairly run down. Nothing really to rave about this place.

Reviews.Title: “YIKES--Avoid this Place”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum Starwood member, I can tell you this place is a royal disappointment. I was upgraded to a suite on the club floor (sounds nice, yes, but read on). Upon checking in, the windows were filthy, a lamp didn't work, and there was black dirt all over the couch. The worst? The hotel faces a busy stretch of highway. If you are the slightest bit sensitive to noise or are a light sleeper, do not stay here. I can sleep through anything, but it felt like my bed had been wheeled out in the middle of Interstate 8 and I was sleeping out there. In a nutshell, this hotel needs a major cleaning job and soundproof windows. Pass it up and stay at the Westin downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you do not have problems after your checkout...”
Reviews.Author: SilvesterPR
Reviews.Content: Was OK until I left it. I had a problem with the reservation charge and two weeks after I still have not got my money back... I have been more that responsible providing all the necessary information, but is something like politics... You chose them already... who matters what happens next. The communication between the hotel and me has not be the one that I am sure Sheraton owners are expecting from them. Besides, it is a very noisy hotel, have to walk far to get something to eat, so you better rent a car. Do not forget to carry your own towel to the "fitness center" and a glass for the water... They sometimes forget to set it up... The only thing I truly liked was the restauran and it variety menu. Good luck... Rafael Cruz

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Labdogs4me
Reviews.Content: We arrived Thanksgiving Morning and inquired about their restaurant and getting a bite to eat. The desk clerk checked us in and pointed to the restaurant. We went to the restaurant and were told they were closed for the day but were serving a $30.00 buffet. No we could not get a cup of coffee, tea... Our room was dirty. The carpets were dirty and the bathroom had mildew throughout. The next day we left early and returned at 5:00 p.m. to find the room had not been serviced. We requested housekkeeping service and were told they would be up at 6:30 pm. We left at 6:30pm and returned at 11:30pm to find housekeeping had not serviced our room. We called the front desk and complained. At midnight we had 3 housekeepers cleaning our room. I requested an adjustment on our bill for the poor service and was assured I would be called by the Manager. It has been 6 days and I have not heard from anyone from the Hotel. The Sheraton is Dirty and the service is VERY poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Lovetospend
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for business/pleasure. My husband had a business meeting Saturday and the location was great for me to take my son out and go shopping. The location is perfect, close to everything. We had a very nice, clean room and were upgraded to the Club Level floor, because of my Starwood Membership. We had a very nice complimentary breakfast on Sunday, totally worth it, especially because I got a great deal on the room with some Starwood points. The following day we went to Sea World which was also minutes away. I read all of the negative review and did not find anything similar to what was written. It was a great hotel for the weekend. I always feel comfortable staying at a Sheraton.
